meanings.definition: A jump in figure skating where the skater takes off from the forward outside edge of one skate and makes one and a half turns in the air before landing on the back outside edge of the other skate.
meanings.sent1: During the competition, she executed a flawless axel, impressing the judges.
meanings.sent2: The skater practiced her axels diligently to improve her performance.
meanings.sent3: The penguin attempted an axel on the ice, but ended up sliding comically instead.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence soared like a soaring axel in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The audience gasped in awe as she gracefully completed the axel with perfect form.

meanings.definition: A rod or spindle (either fixed or rotating) passing through the center of a wheel or group of wheels.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic tightened the axel to ensure the wheel's stability.
meanings.sent2: The axel of the bicycle needed replacement after years of wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the loose axel as a makeshift seesaw in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The axel of progress turned slowly but steadily towards success.
meanings.sent5: The axel's role in keeping the wheels turning smoothly cannot be underestimated.
